code: @Manual{,   title = {ineptR: Get data from Statistics Portugal (Instituto Nacional de Estatistica - Portugal) to R},   author = {Carlos Matos},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000},   url = {https://c-matos.github.io/ineptR/}, }

title: Get data from Statistics Portugal (Instituto Nacional de Estatistica - Portugal) to R
text: goal ineptR facilitate automate data extraction Statistics Portugal (Instituto Nacional de Estatistica - INE, PT) R. consists mainly wrapper functions around INE API, helper functions inspect metadata. One limitation INE API data extraction limited 40k data points API call. convenience, package deals limitation internally, user can get records single get_ine_data function call.

title: Get data from Statistics Portugal (Instituto Nacional de Estatistica - Portugal) to R
text: can install development version ineptR GitHub :

title: Get data from Statistics Portugal (Instituto Nacional de Estatistica - Portugal) to R
text: basic workflow inspect get data INE. Navigate INE website identify desired indicador ID. Example: Proportion domestic budget funded domestic taxes (%); Annual Get indicator ID indOcorrCod query parameter URL. case ID 001003 Confirm indicator ID valid: Inspect metadata: Get information dimensions: many dimensions indicator ? unique values dimension? Get data:
code: #Load package library(ineptR) #Check if indicator is valid is_indicator_valid("0010003") #> [1] TRUE get_metadata("0010003") #> $IndicadorCod #> [1] "0010003" #>  #> $IndicadorNome #> [1] "Percentagem do orçamento de Estado financiado por impostos cobrados internamente (%); Anual - Direção Geral do Orçamento (Ministério das Finanças)" #>  #> $Periodic #> [1] "Anual" #>  #> $PrimeiroPeriodo #> [1] "2010" #>  #> $UltimoPeriodo #> [1] "2023" #>  #> $UnidadeMedida #> [1] "Percentagem (%)" #>  #> $Potencia10 #> [1] "0" #>  #> $PrecisaoDecimal #> [1] "2" #>  #> $Lingua #> [1] "PT" #>  #> $DataUltimaAtualizacao #> [1] "2022-12-28" #>  #> $DataExtracao #> [1] "2023-05-10T20:26:26.926+01:00" get_dim_info("0010003") #> # A tibble: 2 x 3 #>   dim_num abrv                            versao #>   <chr>   <chr>                           <chr>  #> 1 1       Período de referência dos dados XXXXX  #> 2 2       Localização geográfica          03505 get_dim_values("0010003") #> # A tibble: 15 x 7 #>    dim_num cat_id  categ_cod categ_dsg categ_ord categ_nivel value_id         #>    <chr>   <chr>   <chr>     <chr>     <chr>     <chr>       <chr>            #>  1 1       S7A2010 S7A2010   2010      1         1           Dim_Num1_S7A2010 #>  2 1       S7A2011 S7A2011   2011      2         1           Dim_Num1_S7A2011 #>  3 1       S7A2012 S7A2012   2012      3         1           Dim_Num1_S7A2012 #>  4 1       S7A2013 S7A2013   2013      4         1           Dim_Num1_S7A2013 #>  5 1       S7A2014 S7A2014   2014      5         1           Dim_Num1_S7A2014 #>  6 1       S7A2015 S7A2015   2015      6         1           Dim_Num1_S7A2015 #>  7 1       S7A2016 S7A2016   2016      7         1           Dim_Num1_S7A2016 #>  8 1       S7A2017 S7A2017   2017      8         1           Dim_Num1_S7A2017 #>  9 1       S7A2018 S7A2018   2018      9         1           Dim_Num1_S7A2018 #> 10 1       S7A2019 S7A2019   2019      10        1           Dim_Num1_S7A2019 #> 11 1       S7A2020 S7A2020   2020      11        1           Dim_Num1_S7A2020 #> 12 1       S7A2021 S7A2021   2021      12        1           Dim_Num1_S7A2021 #> 13 1       S7A2022 S7A2022   2022      13        1           Dim_Num1_S7A2022 #> 14 1       S7A2023 S7A2023   2023      14        1           Dim_Num1_S7A2023 #> 15 2       PT      PT        Portugal  1         1           Dim_Num2_PT get_ine_data("0010003") #>    dim_1 geocod   geodsg valor #> 1   2010     PT Portugal 58.31 #> 2   2011     PT Portugal 60.04 #> 3   2012     PT Portugal 60.53 #> 4   2013     PT Portugal 58.92 #> 5   2014     PT Portugal  62.1 #> 6   2015     PT Portugal 61.28 #> 7   2016     PT Portugal 64.61 #> 8   2017     PT Portugal 64.55 #> 9   2018     PT Portugal 67.41 #> 10  2019     PT Portugal 69.16 #> 11  2020     PT Portugal 58.01 #> 12  2021     PT Portugal 60.72 #> 13  2022     PT Portugal 64.18 #> 14  2023     PT Portugal 66.08

title: Get information about the dimensions of a given indicator — get_dim_info
Get information about the dimensions of a given indicator — get_dim_info
text: indicator INE indicator ID 7 character string. Example: "0010003". lang "PT" implemented.

title: Get information about the dimensions of a given indicator — get_dim_info
text: data frame dim_num (dimension number), abrv (dimension description) versao (dimension version) selected indicator. fourth column 'nota_dsg' present indicators, additional notes dimensions.

title: Get information about the dimensions of a given indicator — get_dim_info
text: indicator valid, returns 1x1 tibble column named 'value' stating "(PT) O codigo indicador nao existe. / (EN) indicator code exist."  Calling is_indicator_valid() using function recommended.

title: Get information about the dimensions of a given indicator — get_dim_info
code: get_dim_info("0010003") #> # A tibble: 2 × 3 #>   dim_num abrv                            versao #>   <chr>   <chr>                           <chr>  #> 1 1       Período de referência dos dados XXXXX  #> 2 2       Localização geográfica          03505

title: Get unique values for all dimensions of the indicator — get_dim_values
Get unique values for all dimensions of the indicator — get_dim_values
text: indicator INE indicator ID 7 character string. Example: "0010003". lang "PT" implemented.

title: Get unique values for all dimensions of the indicator — get_dim_values
text: data frame dim_num (dimension number), cat_id (dimension description), categ_cod, categ_dsg (Category description), categ_ord (order category appears website), categ_nivel (hierarchical order) value_id (id row data frame) selected indicator.

title: Get unique values for all dimensions of the indicator — get_dim_values
text: indicator valid, returns 1x1 tibble column named 'value' stating "(PT) O codigo indicador nao existe. / (EN) indicator code exist."  Calling is_indicator_valid() using function recommended.

title: Get unique values for all dimensions of the indicator — get_dim_values

what: Get data from the INE API — get_ine_data
title: Get data from the INE API — get_ine_data
text: short description...

title: Get data from the INE API — get_ine_data
code: get_ine_data(   indicator,   lang = "PT",   expected.duration = FALSE,   max_cells = 30000,   ... )

title: Get data from the INE API — get_ine_data
text: indicator INE indicator ID 7 character string. Example: "0010003". lang "PT" implemented. expected.duration TRUE, prints expected remaining duration console. max_cells Integer smaller equal 40000, maximum number cells allowed API call. Default value 30000 ... Values Dimension indicator. parameter form dimN, N one {1, ..., Total number dimensions}. one dimensions included, output includes values

title: Get data from the INE API — get_ine_data
text: desired values

title: Get data from the INE API — get_ine_data
text: Logs expected remaining duration console. Can high indicators many dimensions /many unique values. (E.g. Indicator "0008206 - Deaths Place residence, Sex, Age group Death cause, Annual" take many hours extract completely)

title: Get data from the INE API — get_ine_data
code: get_ine_data("0010003") # A simple example #>    dim_1 geocod   geodsg valor #> 1   2010     PT Portugal 58.31 #> 2   2011     PT Portugal 60.04 #> 3   2012     PT Portugal 60.53 #> 4   2013     PT Portugal 58.92 #> 5   2014     PT Portugal  62.1 #> 6   2015     PT Portugal 61.28 #> 7   2016     PT Portugal 64.61 #> 8   2017     PT Portugal 64.55 #> 9   2018     PT Portugal 67.41 #> 10  2019     PT Portugal 69.16 #> 11  2020     PT Portugal 58.01 #> 12  2021     PT Portugal 60.72 #> 13  2022     PT Portugal 64.18 #> 14  2023     PT Portugal 66.08 get_ine_data("0008206", dim1 = "S7A1996", dim2 = c("11","111"),              dim4 = c(1,19), dim5 = "TLES") # A more complex example #>    dim_1 geocod     geodsg dim_3 dim_3_t dim_4        dim_4_t dim_5 #> 1   1996     11      Norte     2       M     1 Menos de 1 ano  TLES #> 2   1996     11      Norte     1       H     1 Menos de 1 ano  TLES #> 3   1996     11      Norte     T      HM     1 Menos de 1 ano  TLES #> 4   1996     11      Norte     2       M    19 85 e mais anos  TLES #> 5   1996     11      Norte     T      HM    19 85 e mais anos  TLES #> 6   1996     11      Norte     1       H    19 85 e mais anos  TLES #> 7   1996    111 Alto Minho     1       H     1 Menos de 1 ano  TLES #> 8   1996    111 Alto Minho     2       M     1 Menos de 1 ano  TLES #> 9   1996    111 Alto Minho     T      HM     1 Menos de 1 ano  TLES #> 10  1996    111 Alto Minho     T      HM    19 85 e mais anos  TLES #> 11  1996    111 Alto Minho     2       M    19 85 e mais anos  TLES #> 12  1996    111 Alto Minho     1       H    19 85 e mais anos  TLES #>                     dim_5_t valor #> 1  Todas as causas de morte   142 #> 2  Todas as causas de morte   196 #> 3  Todas as causas de morte   338 #> 4  Todas as causas de morte  4832 #> 5  Todas as causas de morte  7154 #> 6  Todas as causas de morte  2322 #> 7  Todas as causas de morte     7 #> 8  Todas as causas de morte     7 #> 9  Todas as causas de morte    14 #> 10 Todas as causas de morte   799 #> 11 Todas as causas de morte   537 #> 12 Todas as causas de morte   262

title: Get indicator metadata — get_metadata
text: get_metadata() calls metadata API. aware function still return value throw error indicator exist.

title: Get indicator metadata — get_metadata
Get indicator metadata — get_metadata
text: indicator INE indicator ID 7 character string. Example: "0010003". lang "PT" implemented.

title: Get indicator metadata — get_metadata
text: API response body list.

title: Get indicator metadata — get_metadata
code: get_metadata("0010003") #> $IndicadorCod #> [1] "0010003" #>  #> $IndicadorNome #> [1] "Percentagem do orçamento de Estado financiado por impostos cobrados internamente (%); Anual - Direção Geral do Orçamento (Ministério das Finanças)" #>  #> $Periodic #> [1] "Anual" #>  #> $PrimeiroPeriodo #> [1] "2010" #>  #> $UltimoPeriodo #> [1] "2023" #>  #> $UnidadeMedida #> [1] "Percentagem (%)" #>  #> $Potencia10 #> [1] "0" #>  #> $PrecisaoDecimal #> [1] "2" #>  #> $Lingua #> [1] "PT" #>  #> $DataUltimaAtualizacao #> [1] "2022-12-28" #>  #> $DataExtracao #> [1] "2023-05-10T20:48:19.765+01:00" #>

title: Check if indicator exists — is_indicator_valid
text: Indicator ID can found url 'indOcorrCod' query parameter browsing website. Example: https://www.ine.pt/xportal/xmain?xpid=INE&xpgid=ine_indicadores&indOcorrCod=0010003&contexto=bd&selTab=tab2

title: Check if indicator exists — is_indicator_valid
Check if indicator exists — is_indicator_valid
text: indicator INE indicator ID 7 character string. Example: "0010003". lang "PT" implemented.

title: Check if indicator exists — is_indicator_valid
text: TRUE indicador exists, otherwise returns FALSE.

title: Check if indicator exists — is_indicator_valid
